intro: Acalypha peduncularis var. punctata, commonly known as the spotted hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple calyx. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and may bear small, yellow or white spots, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.

This plant thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments, often growing in dense vegetation or along forest edges. It is also present in parts of India and the Pacific Islands, where it has been introduced and naturalized. Due to its adaptability, it can be found in a variety of habitats, including gardens and disturbed sites.
